intro: Pycnandra lissophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pycnandra, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
